diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Complicated perforated appendicitis with secondary abscess formation, not amenable to percutaneous drainage.
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with abdominal pain localized to the right lower quadrant, accompanied by fever and malaise. CT findings revealed a poorly defined appendix with extensive surrounding fat stranding, extraluminal gas, and an associated abscess measuring approximately 2.4 x 4.0 cm, indicating a contained perforation. This correlates with the clinical suspicion of complicated appendicitis.
